alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 7:47PM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Up to 1 inch of additional snow accumulation possible before precipitation ends. North winds sustained at 25 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central Colorado, northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous to impossible travel conditions. At 730 PM MST this evening, virtually all major routes in northwest Kansas were closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will taper off from west to east overnight. Blowing snow will persist after precipitation ends. Conditions will not substantially improve until after sunrise Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
